newsitem.title: UK: UK's Offer mulls selected price restraints post 98.
newsitem.headline: UK's Offer mulls selected price restraints post 98.

text.p: Britain's electricity regulator Offer said price restraints after liberalisation of the market in 1998 should cover all domestic customers and business users up to 12,000 kiloWatt hours (kWh).

In publishing the results of a consulation paper on price restraints, Offer said it seemed that separate restraints for different groups of customers could have advantages over the current aggregated approach.
It said "customers should benefit in 1998 and no group of customers should be worse off."
Offer added that maximum price limits would be better than to set restraints on the amount of costs, which could be passed on.
It said there should be further exploration of the possibility of setting maximum price limits.

Other issues covered by the document included putting the responsibility on suppliers to justify price changes and allowing suppliers to price without restrictions outside areas where they are dominant.
